item.title: Overcoming Immutability in Scala
item.description: Originally posted (with minor differences) at slalom.com/thinking on 2016-03-25. So you’ve decided to write some Scala. You’ve been sold on the power and flexibility of the language, you’ve gotten over the initial hurdles of the new syntax, and you’re ready to start writing clean, functional code. Besides, you’ve already mastered a handful of other common languages. How hard can it be to pick up one more? If all your previous languages were mainly imperative, the jump may be harder than you’d expect.
